titleStmt.title: Von Ludwig Wittgenstein an Rowland Hutt, 8. 6. 1944
titleStmt.author: Wittgenstein, Ludwig

sourceDesc.p: Original an der Ã–NB (Autogr. 1280/32-4); Kopie im BA.

list.item: 2007/06: Conversion from Folio Flat File to XML

div.p: Thank you for your letter & the detective mags. I wish you luck & patience! & no more dealings with psychologists.
Drury, I think, has left England for the 2nd front. May he have luck too!
My work hasn't been going too well, which makes my future rather doubtful. I don't intend to come to Cambridge or London in the next 2 months, but I may have to.
If I am near you I'll let you know.
